intro: Doritis zhejiangensis, commonly known as the Zhejiang doritis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of fleshy, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
